coffees.title: Iced Coffee
coffees.description: A coffee with ice, typically served with a dash of milk, cream or sweetener—iced coffee is really as simple as that.

coffees.title: Iced Espresso
coffees.description: Like an iced coffee, iced espresso can be served straight or with a dash of milk, cream or sweetener. You can also ice speciality espresso-based drinks like americanos, mochas, macchiatos, lattes and flat whites.

coffees.title: Cold Brew
coffees.description: The trendiest of the iced coffee bunch, cold brew coffees are made by steeping coffee beans from anywhere between 6-36 hours, depending on how strong you would like your cold brew. Once the beans are done steeping, add cold milk or cream.

coffees.title: Frappuccino
coffees.description: Made famous by Starbucks, the Frappuccino is a blended iced coffee drink that’s topped with whipped cream and syrup.

coffees.title: Nitro
coffees.description: A cold brew + nitrogen bubbles = a cold brew coffee with a frothy, Guinness-like consistency. (It’s poured via a nitro tap, too.)

coffees.title: Mazagran
coffees.description: Mazagran coffee is a cross between iced coffee, tea and your favorite rum drink. It typically consists of espresso, lemon, sugar and (sometimes) rum.
